item.title: Battlefield 6 Devs Explain The Game‚Äôs Most Controversial Setting
item.content:encoded:
In August, the Battlefield 6 open beta was a massive success and one of the most played games of the year. But there was a controversial ‚Äúquick turn‚Äù setting included in the beta that caused some debate online. And when I asked the devs why it was added, they said: Balance and customization.

Earlier this week, Kotaku sat down with two Battlefield 6 devs to discuss the game‚Äôs console ports, and I had to ask about the quick turn feature. People online suggested it looked like cheating and was too OP. Others claimed it helped balance BF6 by giving controller players a chance to turn around quickly. According to Matthew Nickerson, senior console combat designer on Battlefield 6, balancing the game was indeed one reason it was added.

This is a must have setting in #Battlefield6 Flick Look allows you to achieve an instant quick 180 in combat! pic.twitter.com/ElMW1yvrhh

‚Äî TacticalBrit (@TheTacticalBrit) August 7, 2025

‚ÄúThe inherent issue of including aim assist on controller,‚Äù Nickerson told Kotaku,  ‚Äú[is that] you constantly are doing a big sweeping motion [while looking around], you‚Äôre constantly going full speed, and then you hit the bubbles of aim assist, and it automatically slows down. So you‚Äôre kind of constantly fighting these systems that are preventing you from quickly 180 turning.‚Äù

Adding a quick flip option was a ‚Äúhuge win‚Äù that solved a ‚Äúlot of issues‚Äù that exist when playing on a controller against mouse and keyboard players.

‚ÄúYou know, you get shot in the back [and] it‚Äôs frustrating to be a controller player those days,‚Äù added Nickerson. 

According to him, making sure crossplay was balanced, fair, and fun was a huge goal for the entire team working on Battlefield 6. So the quick turn option, officially known as ‚ÄúFlick Stick,‚Äù was one more way to keep crossplay competitive for all.

The other reason for adding it? Well, because it‚Äôs cool and gives players one more way to customize their controls and gameplay. And combined with the PS5‚Äôs gyro controls, Flick Stick can do some ‚Äúreally cool stuff.‚Äù Plus, Nickerson told Kotaku it helps give console players more ways to interact with the game despite gamepads having far fewer buttons than a keyboard.

‚ÄúIf you want to reload [or turn around], maybe you just flick on your controller upright, and it activates the gyro, so it‚Äôs like another new layer of customizability,‚Äù said Nickerson. 

I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll be using gyro controls in Battlefield 6 when it launches on October 10 on PS5, Xbox Series, and PC. But you‚Äôd better believe I‚Äôll have a button set for turning around instantly so I can at least I can see the person killing me from behind.

item.title: Every Pok√©mon Mega Evolution, Ranked From Worst To Best
item.content:encoded:
Mega Evolutions are coming back in Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A. These powerful, temporary transformations are one of the most popular battle gimmicks in the RPG series, and not only is Legends: Z-A giving Pok√©mon the chance to Mega Evolve into their old forms again, it‚Äôs also giving some new Mega forms to Pok√©mon who didn‚Äôt get them the first time around.

These forms typically exaggerate traits possessed by the original Pok√©mon, but some are definitely more compelling than others. Whether we compare design, lore implications, or competitive ability, not all Mega Evolutions are created equal. Some are iconic, having become synonymous with their respective monsters‚Äô designs. Others are not good and have been kind of forgotten, unless they‚Äôre brought up in the context of dunking on how lame they were. There are over 50 of them so far, and we‚Äôre here to rank all of them. We‚Äôll update this ranking as more are revealed leading up to Legends: Z-A.

Latios and Latias

It pains me to put my girl Latias at the bottom of this list, and it pains me even more to have to lump her into one entry with her brother Latios because Game Freak made the two jet plane dragons identical in their Mega forms. The pair‚Äôs blue and red color schemes merge into a uniform purple, and the only real difference between the two is their eye color. A real missed opportunity to diverge them more rather than making them the same.

Mewtwo X

It‚Äôs a good thing Mewtwo got two Mega forms, and one is pretty good, because Mega Mewtwo X‚Äôs bulkier frame looks extremely off on the typically sleek psychic-type legendary. 

Pinsir

Mega Pinsir looks like the kind of unidentifiable bug I would have seen flying around the woods while living in the Georgia boonies, and for that, I think it should be squished.

Sharpedo

Sharpedo‚Äôs the first on this list of Mega Evolutions that just looks like a pre-teen‚Äôs notebook redesign doodle. More stripes and more pointy things. That‚Äôs all.

Tyranitar

See, this is what I‚Äôm talking about. Half of the Mega Evolutions don‚Äôt even seem to have a real concept beyond cranking the visual elements up. 

Garchomp

How is Mega Garchomp going to hold a plate of spaghetti with those scythe hands? 

Venusaur

They gave Venusaur a hat.

Gardevoir

It says a lot about this design that I had to stare at it for several seconds to realize what was different from the original.

Gengar

Gengar‚Äôs third eye opened, and it saw the infinitely superior Gigantamax form it would get in Galar.

Lopunny

Game ‚ÄúFreak‚Äù is right.

Manectric

They made my guy carry the literal weight of electricity on his back.

Pidgeot

I really like the additional blue in the color scheme, but overall, Mega Pidgeot just kinda looks like another regular bird.

Charizard Y

Like Mewtwo, Charizard also has two Mega Evolutions, and one is far superior to the other. Mega Charizard Y looks almost like an early concept for a Mega that didn‚Äôt quite go all the way. At a glance, it looks pretty close to the original, and even its defining trait of a third horn on its head isn‚Äôt that noticeable if you‚Äôre not viewing it from the right angle.

Raichu Y

He‚Äôs cute, but I‚Äôm not a fan of Game Freak making a Raichu form look more like Pikachu.

Greninja

Putting Greninja upside down and hanging off a giant shuriken is a cool concept, but it doesn‚Äôt do much with the actual new design. 

Medicham

Motherfucker said ‚Äúdomain expansion.‚Äù

Absol

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a phase, Mom! This is who I am!‚Äù

Abomasnow

The Pok√©mon world‚Äôs abominable snowman monster becomes more abominable. 

Aggron

A tanky boi becomes an armored tank. I‚Äôd trust him to bulldoze over any foe.

Aerodactyl

I was ready to drop Aerodactyl lower until I saw that, apparently, its Mega form is meant to be what the pterodactyl looked like before it was fossilized, and that‚Äôs pretty cool.

Blaziken and Lucario

I‚Äôm lumping Blaziken and Lucario into the same entry because they‚Äôre basically the same design. They get these cool frilly things that look like martial arts bands. They lean into both Pok√©mon‚Äôs fighting typing to let them aura farm at the top of a tall mountain with the moon in the background, probably.

Scizor

Mega Scizor is a pretty natural exaggeration of the armor-plated bug‚Äôs original form, but it‚Äôs apparently now so full of energy that it‚Äôs actually melting as it holds this form. That‚Äôs metal.

Camerupt 

Mega Camerupt is one of the Mega Evolutions that kinda seems like it should have just been a standard evolution because it builds so well off the original‚Äôs concept. The camel Pok√©mon‚Äôs mountain-like humps turn into an active volcano, and he becomes an angry, explosive dude. It‚Äôs giving Anger from Inside Out.

Mawile

Mawile‚Äôs Mega form is very similar in aesthetic to Blaziken‚Äôs and Lucario‚Äôs, but the weird little guy grows a second mouth on the back of its head, and if you don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs the tightest shit, I don‚Äôt know what to tell you.

Metagross

Metagross now has four arms, which means twice as many hugs.

Heracross

Oh, the smells you will smell with that nose, my guy.

Steelix

The crystalized segments of its extended body are dope, but it‚Äôs also cool as shit that it has its own gravitational pull, with an almost asteroid-belt-like structure floating around its neck.

Rayquaza

Mega Rayquaza nearly approaches the ‚Äúoverdesigned‚Äù threshold by nudging an already pretty elaborate Pok√©mon into something that kinda looks like someone was just slapping decorations on the dragon and seeing what would stick. But Mega Rayquaza‚Äôs lore as a sort of god believed to have been born out of humanity‚Äôs wish for salvation makes him one of the more grandiose and mysterious Mega Evolutions in the series, and I am too much of a Pok√©mon world-building sicko to not give it a bump for that.

Kangaskhan

Mega Kangaskhan is funny because the Mega Evolution mostly applies to the little baby the mother carries in her pouch. It turns into a battle-ready child, and according to the Pokedex, the mother is concerned about its future because it only knows how to fight, and it worries about the day that it is old enough to leave her pouch for good. We love a parental existential crisis in our Mega Evolution.

Gyarados

Mega Gyarados is a bulkier and more destructive version of one of the most terrifying creatures in the Pok√©mon world. The addition of the dark typing makes it intimidating and comes through in its black-and-red design.

Houndoom

My guy is wearing what looks like a mammoth skull around his neck. I love him, your honor.

Glalie

Mega Glalie is one of those really horrifying Mega Evolutions that you almost can‚Äôt believe is in a Pok√©mon game. Its jaw has become unhinged and it can no longer close it, so it goes hungry because it can‚Äôt eat. Hardcore.

Blastoise

Blastoise definitely fares a bit better than Venusaur and Charizard Y in the Mega Evolution department. Brother‚Äôs carrying some heavy artillery on his back now, as well as arm cannons to replace the shoulder ones of its base form. Blastoise becomes a walking arsenal.

Diancie

Diancie goes from a pretty but kinda forgettable mythical Pokemon to a full-blown magical girl after it mega evolves. Slay.

Swampert

Swole boy.

Raichu X

Thank you, Game Freak, for putting respect on Raichu‚Äôs name. Raichu X is a bit overdesigned, but beggars can‚Äôt be choosers. That‚Äôs my boy and shaped like an X. I live.

Chesnaught

Chesnaught hate is so forced, and its Mega Evolution has a kickass mace, so watch your mouth.

Gallade

My guy gets knighted. Look at his sick cape. Mega Gallade is on his way to the Met Gala. I wish my fit went that hard.

Banette

Banette mega evolving and letting all its vindictive life force flow out of its doll-like body goes hard.

Hawlucha

Mega Hawlucha becomes a decorated luchador, and I must give it its flowers.

Dragonite

Mega Dragonite is a divisive form, but I think the way it sports those goofy head wings as a representation of its previous evolution‚Äôs traits is almost a funny meta joke toward those who complain that it doesn‚Äôt look enough like Dragonair. He‚Äôs goofy, but I trust him.

Sableye

Mega Sableye is every introvert‚Äôs fantasy of having something to hide behind at all times. 

Malamar

I am immune to hypnosis, so Mega Malamar was not able to brainwash me into putting it at the top of this list, but this Megamind-ass skinny legend is still serving.

Altaria

Altaria is already one of the most beautiful Pok√©mon in the Pokedex, and giving it an even bigger bougie-ass cloud to carry on its back and a whole puffy white wig on its head has Mega Altaria ready for its Ruveal.

Mewtwo Y

Finally, Mega Mewtwo Y lets Mewtwo become the weird little alien freak he was always meant to be.

Audino

Audino is based on a nurse in its base form, so getting a ‚Äúpromotion‚Äù into a full-blown doctor with a lab coat as a Mega Evolution is a really cute concept, though I think I might have liked it more as a separate evolved form.

Beedrill

Beedrill goes from an unassuming stinger bee to what looks like a vicious hornet. That motherfucker is mean-mugging you at the outdoor lunch function and is about to start flying over your dish.

Victreebel

Another win for the goofy guys. Victreebel wraps vines around its throat to keep all its toxic fluid inside its engorged belly, and as a result, it looks like a smiley doofus. That shit rules, actually.

Salamence

Salamence dreamed of flying as a wee little Bagon, and once it Mega Evolves, it becomes a crescent-moon-shaped, jet-like dragon. It is Icarus flying too close to the sun, achieving the flight it always dreamed of, but has become misshapen in the process. Now it‚Äôs just a violent, flying killing machine. Impeccable concept.

Alakazam

‚ÄúExperience tranquility‚Äù

Delphox

They gave her a witch‚Äôs broom to ride on. She‚Äôs the supreme witch now. 

Sceptile

You know how some reptiles can regrow their tails if they‚Äôre severed in some way? What if that tail was also a missile?

Slowbro

We‚Äôve got one more goofy guy near the top of this list. Mega Slowbro expands on the ‚ÄúShellder latching onto its body‚Äù concept by increasing the shell-like creature‚Äôs hold on Slowbro. Now, instead of hanging out on its tail, it engulfs the whole body, with Slowbro more or less being along for the ride. It bounces on its tail, which pokes out of the bottom of the Shellder, but while all this makes it sound like Mega Evolution is a bad time for the Slowbro, it does benefit from impenetrable armor encasing its body, and it‚Äôs mostly comfortable with the arrangement. 

Charizard X

The most iconic ‚Äúdragon‚Äù in Pok√©mon finally gets to be a dragon type. The blue and black color scheme harkens to its base shiny form, but the blue flames pouring from its mouth at all times imply a growing fiery power that its original form can‚Äôt quite reach. Mega Charizard X is the dragon unshackled.

Ampharos

What if Mega Evolution not only stimulated hair growth, bringing back Ampharos‚Äô pre-evolution white wool, but also awakened dormant dragon‚Äôs blood in the sheep-like line? That‚Äôs fucking sick. Ampharos is the best example of a Mega Evolution not just expanding upon a base concept, but considering what else is possible.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Shooter Allegedly Had Bullet With Possible Helldivers 2 Reference Engraved On It
item.content:encoded:
New information has surfaced in the federal investigation into the assassination of right-wing commentator Charlie Kirk that includes a potentially unexpected link to Helldivers 2. Bullets left behind near the crime scene had markings on them, according to information shared at a news conference on Friday morning by Utah Gov. Spencer Cox, one of which included symbols that line up with a military Stratagem from last year‚Äôs hit sci-fi extraction game.

Investigators said Discord messages from the suspected shooter led them to believe he had engraved the writings on bullets he used to kill Kirk at a Utah Valley University event earlier this week. A bolt-action rifle with a scope was recovered from a wooded area near the school on Thursday, with unfired bullets containing engravings on the casings.

üö®Spencer Cox confirms writings on bullet casings and says they included "hey, fascist" and "if you read this, you are gay LMAO." pic.twitter.com/9gow1IhynD

‚Äî Off The Press (@OffThePress1) September 12, 2025

One of the casings reportedly had the words ‚ÄúHey fascists! Catch!‚Äù on it alongside an up arrow, right arrow, and three down arrows.

While that last part might seem meaningless to most people, Helldivers 2 players immediately understood it to be a reference to the Eagle 500kg Bomb stratagem which requires players to input those button presses on their keyboard or their controller‚Äôs d-pad in order to call down a giant payload that explodes moments later.

‚áß‚á®‚á©‚á©‚á© (Up, Right, Down, Down, Down) is an orbital stratagem code from the game Helldivers II. It calls in an Eagle airstrike that drops a 500K bomb ‚Äî the most destructive piece of single ordinance in the game. https://t.co/GzMvH9Dxrj pic.twitter.com/7M2nfvQFGJ

‚Äî Steve Skojec (@SteveSkojec) September 12, 2025

It‚Äôs not yet clear if the suspected shooter, Tyler Robinson, who was recently arrested in connection with the assassination, meant for the engraving to be connected to Helldivers 2 or what significance that reference would have had in connection with the crime.

What is Helldivers 2?

Helldivers 2 was made by Arrowhead Game Studios and published by Sony for PlayStation 5 and PC early last year, instantly becoming one of 2025‚Äôs most popular games after selling over 10 million copies. The multiplayer shooter has players step into the shoes of space marines as they battle alien threats across the galaxy as a parody of sci-fi fascism in the vein of Starship Troopers.

Helldivers 2 came to Xbox Series X/S just last month and has continued to be one of the most played games on PC and console in part due to constantly-evolving in-game storytelling and a robust social community of dedicated players. Players team up, go down to random planet surfaces, complete mini-objective while dodging waves of hostile aliens, and repeatedly die in often absurd ways thanks to the game‚Äôs complex ragdoll physics.

Players have been flooding the game‚Äôs Discord today following the press conference sharing their shock and disgust, as well as debating whether Arrowhead Game Studios should make a statement addressing the situation. Robinson‚Äôs name has already been banned from the Helldivers 2 Discord servers so that any attempt to mention the suspected shooter by name is automatically filtered out.

‚ÄúWeird day to be a Helldivers mod‚Äù

On the game‚Äôs subreddits, which include over 1.5 million members, fans have been trying to process the news. ‚ÄúNot for nothing, but it‚Äôs gonna be weird to have one of these tattoos,‚Äù one player wrote in a thread referencing a past photo shared by someone over a year ago with a tattoo of the same Eagle 500kg Bomb stratagem reportedly referenced on Robinson‚Äôs bullets. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt let some delusional person take what‚Äôs ours,‚Äù wrote another.

‚ÄúCommunity is necessary because of events like this,‚Äù wrote one of the subreddit‚Äôs moderators. ‚ÄúIf we as people spent more time learning about each other and overcoming our differences instead of bickering we might actually achieve equity and not just equality. As Helldivers it‚Äôs our responsibility to keep those we love and are sworn to protect safe from outside evils.  Sometimes those evils exist within our own society.‚Äù

Politicians have long tried to link gun violence with video games, including President Donald Trump. Earlier this week, health secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said his department was looking into any potential links between gaming and increases in school shootings. The U.S. suffers from exponentially more school shootings than other countries, despite having the same number of video games.

Updated, 9/12/2025 12:53 p.m. ET: Added more reactions from Helldivers 2 players.
